plugin.name: Multi Module Maven Release Plugin :: Plugin
plugin.description: Maven plugin to release multi-module Maven projects where only changed modules should be released

mojo.description: Display help information on release-maven-plugin. Call mvn releaser:help -Ddetail=true -Dgoal=<goal-name> to display parameter details.

parameter.name: detail
parameter.description: If true, display all settable properties for each goal.

parameter.name: goal
parameter.description: The name of the goal for which to show help. If unspecified, all goals will be displayed.

parameter.name: indentSize
parameter.description: The number of spaces per indentation level, should be positive.

parameter.name: lineLength
parameter.description: The maximum length of a display line, should be positive.

mojo.description: Logs the versions of the modules that the releaser will release on the next release. Does not run the build nor tag the repo.

parameter.name: buildNumber
parameter.description:
The build number to use in the release version. Given a snapshot version of '1.0-SNAPSHOT' and a buildNumber value of '2', the actual released version will be '1.0.2'.
By default, the plugin will automatically find a suitable build number. It will start at version 0 and increment this with each release.
This can be specified using a command line parameter ('-DbuildNumber=2') or in this plugin's configuration.

parameter.name: debugEnabled
parameter.description: Specifies whether the release build should run with the '-X' switch.

parameter.name: knownHosts
parameter.description: If set, this file will be used to specify the known_hosts. This will override any default value.

parameter.name: modulesToForceRelease
parameter.description: A module to force release on, even if no changes has been detected.

parameter.name: modulesToRelease
parameter.description: The modules to release, or no value to to release the project from the root pom, which is the default. The selected module plus any other modules it needs will be built and released also. When run from the command line, this can be a comma-separated list of module names.

parameter.name: passphrase
parameter.description: Specifies the passphrase to be used with the identityFile specified.

parameter.name: privateKey
parameter.description: Specifies the private key to be used.

parameter.name: remoteRepositoryEnabled
parameter.description: Specifies whether the plugin should also work with the remote repository. If true, the remote repository will be taken into account during the release process. This property has only an effect, when a distributed SCM like GIT is used. On client/server SCMs like Subversion, this property is ignored. Default value is true.

parameter.name: serverId
parameter.description: If set, the identityFile and passphrase will be read from the Maven settings file.

parameter.name: buildNumber
parameter.description:
The build number to use in the release version. Given a snapshot version of '1.0-SNAPSHOT' and a buildNumber value of '2', the actual released version will be '1.0.2'.
By default, the plugin will automatically find a suitable build number. It will start at version 0 and increment this with each release.
This can be specified using a command line parameter ('-DbuildNumber=2') or in this plugin's configuration.

parameter.name: debugEnabled
parameter.description: Specifies whether the release build should run with the '-X' switch.

parameter.name: globalSettings
parameter.description: Specifies a custom, global Maven settings file to be used during the release build.

parameter.name: goals
parameter.description:
The goals to run against the project during a release. By default this is 'deploy' which means the release version of your artifact will be tested and deployed.
You can specify more goals and maven options. For example if you want to perform a clean, build a maven site, and then deploys it, use:
<releaseGoals> <releaseGoal>clean</releaseGoal> <releaseGoal>site</releaseGoal> <releaseGoal>deploy</releaseGoal> </releaseGoals>

parameter.name: knownHosts
parameter.description: If set, this file will be used to specify the known_hosts. This will override any default value.

parameter.name: localMavenRepo
parameter.description: Specifies a custom directory which should be used as local Maven repository.

parameter.name: modulesToForceRelease
parameter.description: A module to force release on, even if no changes has been detected.

parameter.name: modulesToRelease
parameter.description: The modules to release, or no value to to release the project from the root pom, which is the default. The selected module plus any other modules it needs will be built and released also. When run from the command line, this can be a comma-separated list of module names.

parameter.name: passphrase
parameter.description: Specifies the passphrase to be used with the identityFile specified.

parameter.name: privateKey
parameter.description: Specifies the private key to be used.

parameter.name: releaseProfiles
parameter.description:
Profiles to activate during the release.
Note that if any profiles are activated during the build using the `-P` or `--activate-profiles` will also be activated during release. This gives two options for running releases: either configure it in the plugin configuration, or activate profiles from the command line.

parameter.name: remotePushEnabled
parameter.description: Specifies whether the plugin should push changes to the remote repository. This property has only an effect, when a distributed SCM like GIT is used. If remoteRepositoryEnabled is disabled and a distributed SCM like GIT is used, this property has no effect.

parameter.name: remoteRepositoryEnabled
parameter.description: Specifies whether the plugin should also work with the remote repository. If true, the remote repository will be taken into account during the release process. This property has only an effect, when a distributed SCM like GIT is used. On client/server SCMs like Subversion, this property is ignored. Default value is true.

parameter.name: serverId
parameter.description: If set, the identityFile and passphrase will be read from the Maven settings file.

parameter.name: skipTests
parameter.description: If true then tests will not be run during a release. This is the same as adding -DskipTests=true to the release goals.

parameter.name: userSettings
parameter.description: Specifies a custom, user specific Maven settings file to be used during the release build.
